info.name: PROJECT1-REST APIs
info.description:
Type: REST APIs

Classification: Public APIs + Secured APIs

Authorization: Bearer Access Token

How to get my bearer access token : Login to the [https://gorest.co.in/](https://gorest.co.in/) website and get your token

\# of APIs developed: 4

HTTP methods used: GET, POST, PATCH, DELETE

Format of API documentation: cURL

Documentation is available at [https://gorest.co.in/](https://gorest.co.in/)

item.name: POSITIVE TC

exec: pm.test("Verify if response code is 200 OK", function () {
pm.test("Verify if response time < 5 seconds", function () {
pm.test("Verify if response body is received from server", function () {
pm.test("Verify if response body is received in JSON format", function () {
pm.test("Verify if response body contains fields such as id, name, email, gender, status", function () {
console.log("The response time from server is "+pm.response.responseTime+" ms");
console.log("The response size received from server is ");
console.log("The response body received from server in JSON format is ");
console.log("The response body received from server in TEXT format is ");
console.log("The response headers received from server are ");

request.description:
This is a REST API that uses HTTP method=GET and is used to retrieve/read/fetch all the existing users details from the server/database

**Expected Result:**

- Verify if response code received from server is 200 OK
    
- Verify if response time from server < 5 seconds
    
- Verify if response body is received from server
    
- Verify if response body received from server is in JSON format
    
- Verify if response body contains fields such as id, name, email, gender, status

exec: pm.test("Verify if response code is 201 Created", function () {
pm.test("Verify if response time < 5 seconds", function () {
pm.test("Verify if response body is received from server", function () {
pm.test("Verify if response body is received in JSON format", function () {
pm.test("Verify if response body contains fields such as id, name, email, gender, status", function () {
pm.test("Verify if gender is either male or female", function () {
pm.test("Verify if status is active or inactive", function () {
console.log("The data type for id field is "+typeof(pm.response.json().id));
console.log("The data type for name field is "+typeof(pm.response.json().name));
console.log("The data type for status field is "+typeof(pm.response.json().status));
console.log("The data type for gender field is "+typeof(pm.response.json().gender));
console.log("The data type for email field is "+typeof(pm.response.json().email));

request.description:
This is a REST API that uses HTTP method=POST and is used to create new user in the server/database

**Expected Result:**

- Verify if response code received from server is 201 Created
    
- Verify if response time from server < 5 seconds
    
- Verify if response body is received from server
    
- Verify if response body received from server is in JSON format
    
- Verify if status is active or inactive
    
- Verify if gender is either male or female

exec: pm.test("Verify if response code is 200 OK", function () {
pm.test("Verify if response time < 5 seconds", function () {
pm.test("Verify if response body is received from server", function () {
pm.test("Verify if response body is received in JSON format", function () {
pm.test("Verify if response body contains fields such as id, name, email, gender, status", function () {
console.log("The HTTP method used in this request is "+pm.request.method);
console.log("The API URL used in this request is "+pm.request.url);
console.log("The payload used in this API request is "+pm.request.body);
console.log("The request headers of this API are ");

exec: pm.test("Verify if response code is 204 No Content", function () {
pm.test("Verify if response time < 2 seconds", function () {
pm.test("Verify if response body is not received from server", function () {

request.description:
This is a REST API that uses HTTP method=DELETE and is used to delete existing user details in the server/database.  
**  
Expected Result:**

- Verify if response code received from server is 204 No Content
    
- Verify if response time from server < 5 seconds
    
- Verify if response body is not received from server

item.description:
Test the API with an invalid/incorrect/incomplete payload (request body) ; exp response code: 4xx client side error ;

\-> invalid gender  
\-> invalid status  
\-> invalid data type  
\-> invalid data length  
\-> missing payload fields  
\-> new payload fields  
\-> empty payload fields
This folder consists of negative test cases
